data.title: Hindi Tv Serial Pancham
data.meta_description: Pancham is a Hindi Television Serial, Read The Synopsis, Episodes, Cast & Crew with Character names and Original names
data.text:
Pratichi Mishra is a well known face of TV entertainment industry. She is originally from Lucknow and completed her academics from Lucknow, Gurgaon and Madurai. For higher studies she went to Chennai and completed her BA in Hindi language. She was appointed as Hindi teacher in Chennai and worked there for almost 20 years. Meanwhile she was interested in acting and done many short roles in Tamil Cinema and TV serials. She came to Mumbai along with her family and joined a local theater and there she got noticed by the team of Sphere Origins which produced Saat Phere - Saloni Ka Safar.

She was selected in the audition and got a chance to debut her carrier in Hindi entertainment industry in 2005 with Rakesh Sarang’s Saat Phere. The show aired the story of Saloni who had comparatively dark complexion. She got neglected from her husband and fellow family members but during the episodes she managed to get her identity and proven herself. Pratichi played the negative role of Ambika, who was mother of Saloni. The show bagged many awards for acclaimed performances.

She has also acted in Amitabh Bachchan and Akshay Kumar starrer Family in 2006 for a very short but noticeable role. After doing many other cameos and short roles in regional languages, she participated in the audition for Sanjay Leela Bhansali’s mega serial Saraswati Chandra and got selected there for the role of Saubhagyaa Dharmadikari. The show was aired on Star Plus with the story of Saraswatichandra (aka Saras) and Kumud who struggled for their love.

Currently she is working on Sony TV’s show Kya Hua Tera Vaada as Mrs. Chopra opposite to Mr. Chopra played by veteran actor Gajendra Chauhan.

...

Mrinal Deshraj is a Hindi television and film actress who appeared in the popular Indian soap, Kahiin to Hoga on STAR Plus. She bagged the role of Shipra Arora, the daughter of Mr. Ahluwalia (played by Tinnu Anand). She is a fashion designer who came from London. Mrinal was also part of the Shekhawat family in the Hindi soap, Doli Saja Ke on Sahara One. Then she did the antagonist role of Sejal, the daughter of Faiba (played by Renuka Israni) in the Hindi serial, Sujata – Ek Stree Ka Samarpan on Sony TV. She also essayed the role of Revati, the mother of Sam (played by Vipul Gupta) and Kuhu. She is the main antagonist in this serial and the wife of Girish (played by Mihir Mishra). Later, she quits the show. It has been said that the reason behind it is that her character was unable to make an impact to the viewers. Recently, Mrinal was added to the twists and turns of the historical drama serial, Bharat Ka Veer Putra – Maharana Pratap. She played the obnoxious character of Uma. Mrinal Deshraj biography describes her entire profile.

...

Rohini Hattangadi is an Indian actress who can be called as a veteran in the true sense of the term. She is a very senior actress, who debuted with the movie called ‘Arvind Desai Ki Ajeeb Dastaan’ in 1978. She has an experience of around 35 years and she has been widely appreciated and critically perceived very well by the audiences and critics respectively. Some of her noted works are popular movies such as ‘Arth’ (1982), ‘Saaransh’ (1984) & ‘Gandhi’ (1982). She won a lot of recognition for her role of Kastoorba Gandhi in Sir Richard Attenborough’s ‘Gandhi’ (1982), which was a critical success and it won an Academy Award for the best film category. Rohini won the BAFTA Award for her role in this movie.

...

Nitika Anand is a famous film, TV and theatre actress who has done many commercially successful assignments. As per many of her interviews she is the owner of most charming wheatish look with beautiful smile.

Before working as a committed TV actress she has worked for many films, ad films and theatre plays. She was the part of an English film The Memsaahib, directed by Kriti Majoomdar and produced by Khusro films. She essayed the character of an out casted Queen Laxmi due to her resignation as a Queen for the passion of dance.

She was also associated with Ekjute theatre group headed by Nadira Zahir and acted in many plays while got highly acclaimed for Hindi version of Romeo and Juliet. She was spotted in many ad films too like Rin, Collin, Hamdard, Comfort fabric conditions, Vodafone and Max Life Insurance.

The latest engagements of her were with TV serials as Chand Chupa Badal Mein, Mera Sasural, Swaare Sabke Sapne – Preeto and Bani – Ishq Da Kalma. In Bani, she essayed the role of Manpreet Bhullar a relative of lead character Bani. The show narrated the story about Bani who was neglected by her husband but she fought back to win all of the rights of a Wife.

...

Nazneen is a television actress who has been a part of the industry for a couple of years and done a couple of serials. She was seen in the serial Kyun Hota Hai Pyaar. This show was a weekly show that featured on Star Plus every Thursday evening. The show was a love story between a small town girl, and a rich spoilt brat from the city, who fall in love at college. In this serial Naveen plays a friend to the protagonists. She is also a college student. She plays a tomboy in the show.

Nazneen has also been seen in the serial Mukti Bandhan, which is the story of an ordinary man, who starts doing extremely well in the business world, with the support and help from his wife. She has also featured in the 2008 movie, Good Luck that tells the tale of one’s destiny, and how it can change overnight. Also seen in the supporting roles for the show, Haunted Nights, on Sahara One, by Vikram Bhatt!

Her current television ranking is 1664, and that in the last week was 1773. She reached the peak of her fame in May, 2010, when her rank was only 42, that speaks for being very popular. She has also been known for playing a role of a journalist in Main Aisi Kyun Hoon, by Paresh Rawal where her character is called Sanjana Pushpa Patil. Here she writes a column called Pyaar Love, but her own life has no love affairs. Love is completely nonexistent in her own life. She done a bit of modelling too, and has successfully settled in the city of Mumbai, in the television industry.

...

Meenakshi Verma is popular for playing dadi/nani (grand mother) roles on screen. She is an Indian actress who worked in both Television as well as Movies. She acted in the legendary serials of all times “Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi” that aired on Star Plus for almost 5 years. She was also seen in the serial “Yeh Pyaar Na Hoga Kam” that aired on Colors TV from 2009 to 2010. Her other serials were “Ganga Ki Dheej”, “Gunaho Ka Devta” and a few more. The next major role that she received is to play mother to male lead in the serial “Shubh Vivaah” aired on Sony TV. Hers was an important role as she exercised full control on her son (male lead of the show) and influenced him while taking decisions. Shubh Vivah had a very strong cast like Eijaz Khan and Aashka Goradia as main leads but couldn’t attract as many viewers so the channel had to finally step in and axe the show. Later she was roped in to play the role of grandmother to the male lead in the serial “Khoobsurat – Dil ki Nazar se”. Here she played the role of a beautiful, loving and caring grandma who wanted to get her grand son married to a pretty girl. Meenakshi also played a cameo role in the serial “Madhubala – Ek Ishq Ek Junoon”. She played the character of a caretaker for mentally handicapped Raju (male lead).

Meenakshi Verma also acted in the Hindi movie “Life in a Metro” as Minakshi and in “Straight from the heart” movie as Pushpa. Her other Hindi movie is “Dahek: A restless mind”. In Dahek she was the mother of female lead. Her role in the movie was different from her other roles which she played till then.

Though she played many roles, she is widely remembered as Kaushalya from Shubh Vivaah.

...

Alka Kaushal is a veteran Indian actress and a popular personality in the Marathi cinema. She was born on September 2, 1969 in India. Before moving to Mumbai, she started acting on a theatre in New Delhi along with the National School of Drama Repertory.

She got her fame for the role she played in the Indian soap, Kumkum on STAR Plus. She played a negative role as Sukanya Bua, a villain who brings hell to the life of Kumkum (played by Juhi Parmar). Alka was debuted as a television actress in Gaatha under the production of Ramesh Sippy. But the film was said to be copied from Shashi Ranjan’s, The Shotgun Show.

Alka also appeared in the television serial, Tum Pukar Lo under the direction of Sanjay Upadhaya. Alka also played as Smriti on Zee TV’s Manzilein Apani Apani and Sahara One’s, Prratima. Along with her variety of television shows, she was also part of the serial, Faasle, Zee TV’s 9 Malabar Hill and Sansar. She also acted in Kartavya and appeared as a lawyer in Kammal. She also replaced the character of Bhairavi (played by Tuhinaa Vora), the aunt of Pankaj in the popular Sphere Origin’s serial, Jyoti on Imagine TV. Tuhinaa left the show because of some health issues. Additionally, Alka’s role as Raziya Gaffur Ahmed Siddiqui in the popular soap, Qubool Hai received positive responses from the viewers.

She was married to popular serial director and producer, Ravi Kaushal. Alka and his husband also run the Mangalam Arts Production House and produced some television shows like Meet Mila De Rabba and Kho Gayi Manzilein… Kho Gayi. Not many people are aware that Alka is the sister of Delhi actor, Varun Bhdola and radio jockey, Kalindi. Her mother is Susheela and her father, Vishwa Mohan Badola is a popular small screen Hindi actor who was last seen in the comedy film, Lage Raho Munnabhai. Alka and her dad also acted in some plays in Delhi way back.

Alka is also part of the BAG Films Association which is the producers of Kumkum and Tum Pukar Lo was their first soap opera. Alka is a bit careful on doing films because she is more comfortable in serials. She said, in television, it is easier to define where the character is heading, unlike in films where you don’t know what happens to the character at the end of the story.

...

We would all remember her as, "Chaya" Parvati's sister-in-law in ‘Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii’ telecasted on ‘Star Plus’. It was one of the most popular shows under Balaji Productions. Her real name is ‘Rinku Dhawan Karmarkar’. Rinku is married to actor ‘Kiran Karmarkar’ who played her brother (Om) in the show 'Kahaani Ghar Ghar Kii' and is also seen in Bollywood movies like ‘Force’. She is blessed with a son, “Ishaan” who is seven years old. The show won many awards including ‘Indian Telly Awards’ for ‘The Best Drama Series’ in 2002. The show was very popular with a high TRP. She is also known for the daily soap opera ‘Na Bole Tum Na Maine Kuch Kaha’ (2012). In this programme, she played a double role. She played a comic character, that loves drama and likes to be a drama queen. This show was filmed in ‘Indore’ and gave her a huge fan following during its filming. She was also seen in ‘Palampur Express’ show, that was telecasted on Sony. She played the role of ‘Sudha Bua’ – the aunt of Pavni. Her character in show was very nice, good hearted and humorous. She is a family oriented person and likes to spend as much time as possible with her family. She even likes to be a homemaker and respects it. She respects her husband's priorities and supports him in every possible way. She is ready to do theater, play, daily soaps, and reality shows too.

...

Dinesh Kaushik is a Punjabi actor, born on May 27, 1957 in Bhatinda, Punjab in India. A theatre graduate of Punjab University in Chandigarh, the actor has worked with the professional theatre artists in Mumbai. He also donned several advertisements, TV shows and films. He started his career by playing the role of Narsinghrao Pradhanmantri (Jhansi’s Prime Minister) in the historical drama series, Jhansi Ki Rani on Zee TV channel in 2009. Prior to this, he also acted in the television series, Raghukul Reet Sada Chali Aayi, along with Rajesh Khanna and Jaya Bhattacharya in 2008.

Dinesh started his career in doing theatre acts and became an active member of Majma Theatre Groups and Ekjute Theatre Groups. He also became a regular face in the television commercials, especially for the leading brands in the 80’s like Cadbury, Tree Top, Keo-Karpin, Thumbs Up, Hero Honda Motor Bikes, Girnar Tea, Surf, Vicks and Mayur Suitings. Later on, he shifted and focused on doing television series and films. Dinesh also made an appearance in the T series video album entitled Main Pardesi Hoon.

Dinesh has donned several television shows and serials, including Pancham, Hip Hip Hurray, Commander, Parampara, Tum Bin Jaon Kaha, X Zone and Ghar Ki Lakshmi Betiyaan on Zee TV channel. He also appeared on Star Plus’ Kora Kaagaz, Kumkum, Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi, and Meri Awaaz Ko Mil Gayee Roshni. The actor also donned television serials on the Doordarshan channel, including Mahabharat, Kunti, Raaz Ki Baat, Anoogoonj, Raghukul Reet Sada Chali Aayi and more. Dinesh also donned Remix, Ssshhhh… Koi Hai and Ssshhhh… Phir Koi Hai on Star One; Vaidehi, CID, Aahat and Par Is Dil Ko Kaise Samjhae on Sony TV and few serials on Life OK and Sahara One channels.

He made his debut in the big screen through the 1986 Hindi film entitled Ankush, which was written, produced and directed by N. Chandra. In 1991, he appeared in the Bollywood musical romantic film, Jeena Teri Gali Mein, followed by his appearance in the 1993 horror film, Mahakaal. In 1999, Dinesh played as the brother of Sonali Bendre in the action drama film, Sarfarosh, helmed by John Matthew Matthan. He also got the chance to work with the Bollywood star, Salman Khan in the box-office musical romantic drama film, Tere Naam. In 2002, Dinesh has acted with Anil Kapoor’s first production venture, Badhaai Ho Badhaai, a film which was inspired by the America’s The Nutty Professor. He also worked in the thriller film Vaada in 2005 and in Jackie Shroff-starrer Bhoot Unkle in 2006.

He got married to Ragini and they have been blessed with two daughters namely Ruchika and Simran.

...

Pawan Kumar is a Kannada film and TV director, actor and screen writer. He was born on 29th October 1982 in bengalaru. He began his career with the movie ‘Lifeu’ and later worked in ‘Isntene’ for which he wrote the script and contributed in terms of acting and direction also. Followed by this, another release, ‘lucia’, in the year 2013 made him the favourite of many.

In the initial days of his career during 1998, Pawan worked in the theatre. He attended various workshops to polish his skills and ultimately became very confident and courageous to take bold steps in his career. He was the associate director with Yograj bhat.

Kumar also made many short films. He was a finalist in Indian young achiever 2006. In the industry, he is known as that candle which illuminates the path of the young talent entering this glamour world. He holds film workshop to support young film makers. You can contact him through social sites and he avails you with all his experience, talking of how to make career in the film industry.

As an actor he has worked in block buster movies like ‘Mr. Garagasa, circus, manasaare’ etc and has written the scripts of the movies like ‘Manasaare and panchrangi’.

He was applauded for his commendable work with awards like Best actor tespo 2002, best creative direction for times play fest, audience award at 4th London Indian film festival for the movie ‘lucia’, and film fare best director kannada for the same. His upcoming project is c10H14N2.

The actor closely links theatre and films, considering both as the equally important art forms.

In 2004 he founded an English theatre company and has produced more than 70 public shows in his theatre production.

...

Siraj is a well-known face in the Indian Television. He is a talented actor. He has done many roles in different serials. He has worked on the series of 'Zee Horror Show' (1993-1997). He has worked on the series named Dehshat, it was a very famous series in the year 1995. This show was produced by Ramsay Brothers; they were famous for horror films in 70’s and 80’s. This show was aired on Zee TV. This show was hit in 90’s and each story was based on different suspense and each story continued for 4 to 5 episodes. He was seen in 'Jai Hanuman', a Hindu religious series based on Hanuman’s life, directed by Sanjay Khan. This series was first aired on DD Metro and then later was aired on Sony Entertainment Television in 2008.

...

Prithvi Zutshi is a well-known film and television actor. He donned films like Drohkaal and Ghulam. He was also part of the box-office romantic musical film, Andaaz in 2003 and the Bollywood suspense psychological film, Aetbaar in 2004. Later, the actor played the role Sameer Sikander in the Bollywood action thriller film, Elaan in 2005. He also appeared in the Hindi film, Ek Khiladi Ek Haseena; the remake of the Hollywood film, Confidence in the same year. Also in 2005, the actor played as Dwarka in the Hindi crime drama film, Apaharan under the direction of Prakash Jha. In 2006, he appeared in the Bollywood crime thriller film, The Killer. Later, he was seen in Mohan Sharma’s Ruslaan and the Hindi film, Apni Yaari Jaan Se Pyari. He was also part of the 2007 Hindi film, Yaara along with Shabnam Kapoor and Sangeeta Tiwari. Prithvi also acted as the father of Aman (played by Aditya Narayan) in the box-office Bollywood film, Shaapit by Vikram Bhatt. In 2011, he acted in the movie, Aashiqon Ko Jalana Buri Baat Hai. In the same year, he was seen in the Bollywood thriller film, B & W: The Black and White Fact by Harbans Laali and in 2011, he was also seen in the film, Mere Aashiq.

He has done television serials as well; Prithvi was part of the television serial, Rishton Ke Bhanwar Mein Uljhi Niyati on Sahara One. The actor became widely acclaimed for his performance in the political documentary series, Pradhanmantri. His portrayal as Vallabhhai Patel gained him praises and appreciation by the audience. He also made an appearance in the horror fiction show, Haunted House on Sahara One in 2013. Prithvi was also part of the drama soap, Sapne Suhane Ladakpan Ke on Zee TV. He also made an episodic in the Hindi crime-based show, Savdhaan India – India Fights Back on Life OK and played as the father of the wedded boys who will get into trouble. Last 2014, the actor made an entry as MLA Beniwal, the politician father of Kuldeep (played by Alokk Narula) in the television series, Kaisa Yeh Ishq Hai… Ajab Sa Risk Hai on Life OK. He also acted as Harishankar Pandey, the father-in-law of Alka (played by Neha Pednekar) in the series, Shastri Sisters – Chaar Dil Ek Dhadkan which was aired on Colors TV in 2014.

Prithvi is the real-life father of Kunal Singh who happens to be his co-actor in Niyati.

...

Jayant Rawal is Indian actor who has acted in a few television serials like ‘Dholi Armaanon Ki’. The television serial ‘Dholi Armaanon Ki’ is about a young girl who has many dreams and hopes about how her husband should be and had many plans and dreams about her married life. However this dream and hopes are shattered after she meets her groom. He is completely different and has a different mind-set and perspective about married life. This bitter reality strikes the young girl and she is depressed. Jayant Rawal is portraying the character of a father. He is acting as a father of a female protagonist.

Jayant Rawal has also signed for his role in the new television serial ‘Nisha Aur Uske Cousins’ produced by Motwani Bondhi’s Tree production house and will be broadcasted in Star Plus. This television serial would be his second venture after the first successful serial debut, ‘Dholi Armaanon Ki’. The story of ‘Nisha Aur Uske Cousins’ is about a middle class family of Rajasthan and Jayant Rawal will be playing the role of one of the three sons. Other sons are played by Jagat Rawal and Vivek Mushran. The character of father and mother are played by V.M Badola and Veena Mehta respectively. Jayant Rawal will be the eldest of the three sons and he will try to impersonate and copy his father. He would feel like he should dictate his smaller brothers as he is the eldest of them all. The story revolves around the frustration and irritation of Jayant Rawal as things does not happen in the way expects them to happen. The show is expected to be popular and successful and is expected to be released by late August 2014.

...

Gufi Paintal is a Bollywood actor who acted in some famous movies in 1980s. He also played leading roles in television serials and plays. Even His brother and his nephew are also actors. He was born near Amritsar in Punjab in a Sikh Family. In his childhood, he lived with his family members in Delhi.

He was an outsider in the film industry until the age of 20, after completing his engineering, he arrived in Mumbai. By then his younger brother was already trained in acting. In the same way in 1969 Gufi took up modeling as his field, later on he also worked in movies as an assistant director. After it, he took up direction and also directed his brother.

He was very famous for his well-known character of Shakuni Mama in the serial Mahabharat which was adapted from original Mahabharat and filmed by Mr. B. R. Chopra and his son Mr. Ravi Chopra. Gufi Paintal himself realized that it was his best role ever. He also worked for a channel Sahara Samay in which he played character of Shakuni in political discussion shows, which were also quite famous and brought fame upon him for the character.

In the year 1993, he was awarded as the best actor for his character among 13 others in the world at prestigious Cannes Film festivals. In his own words “I always feel proud of the fact that my job was appreciated”

He also took up direction recently and directed a movie named Shri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. The Movie is the sketch regarding the life of Chaitanya Mahaprabhu, a 16th-century Great devotee of Lord Sri Krishna who is also well recognized as an incarnation of the god by followers of Gaudiya Vaishnavism (followers of Lord Vishnu).

He recently took up the post of head at the well-known acting academy in 2010 known as an Abbhinnay Acting Academy in Mumbai, which is established by his friend and serial Mahabharata co-star Pankaj Dheer.

...

Adarsh Gautam is an Indian actor who is famous for his TV serials Suryaputra Shanidev, Ek Chadar Maili Si and Vatsyayana Kamasutra. He was first seen on TV with the serial EK Chadar Maili Si on December 5, 1986 which was directed by the famous director Sukhwant Dhadda. He played the role of a killer that made the family of the one he killed suffered from so much pain.

After that, he dubbed in the show Sahasa Veerudu Sagara Kanya in the year 1996. A year after that, he was part of the Hindi show, Suryaputra Shanidev together with the beautiful actress, Anuradha Paudwal on 1997. Adarsh Gautam was last seen in Vatsyayana Kamasutra on March 9, 2011. After a year of rest, Adarsh Gautam was set to come back to the TV industry in the Sony Entertainment’s Shubh Vivah as Saroj’s rich uncle. In this serial, he will help Saroj to have her return to Sasural. After confirming his come back to the industry, he was very happy and very interested in playing the role.

...
